Getting Started

Here are some simple examples to let you get started quickly with JRuyi. However, to understand JRuyi better, it's necessary to get some knowledge of OSGi first.

Throughout this whole Getting Started, $JRUYI_HOME is used to refer to the installation directory (home directory) of JRuyi. Please see here for how to install JRuyi.

All the examples are given under a UNIX-like environment. It should be very straightforward for you to make them work on Windows. Just use the counterpart BAT file for a shell script file mentioned in the examples. For example, use ruyi.bat for ruyi and ruyi-cli.bat for ruyi-cli.

To get the source code of examples, please check jruyi-eg on Github.

  • Building a Discard Server
  • Building an Echo Server
  • Creating Your Maven Project
  • Deploying Your Bundle
  • Writing a Daytime Server
  • Writing a Gateway
